t: Psalm 38
A psalm of David. A petition.
Lord,*spn do not rebuke me in your anger or*ld discipline me in your wrath.
Your*ln arrows have pierced me, and*ld your hand has come down on me.
Because*ln of your wrath there is no health in my body; there*ld is no soundness in my bones because of my sin.
My*ln guilt has overwhelmed me like*ld a burden too heavy to bear.
My*pn wounds fester and are loathsome because*ld of my sinful folly.
I*ln am bowed down and brought very low; all*ld day long I go about mourning.
My*ln back is filled with searing pain; there*ld is no health in my body.
I*ln am feeble and utterly crushed; I*ld groan in anguish of heart.
All*pn my longings lie open before you, Lord; my*ld sighing is not hidden from you.
My*ln heart pounds, my strength fails me; even*ld the light has gone from my eyes.
My*ln friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds; my*ld neighbors stay far away.
Those*ln who want to kill me set their traps, those*ld who would harm me talk of my ruin; all*ld day long they scheme and lie.
I*pn am like the deaf, who cannot hear, like*ld the mute, who cannot speak;
I*ln have become like one who does not hear, whose*ld mouth can offer no reply.
Lord,*sln I wait for you; you*ld will answer, Lord my God.
For*ln I said, “Do not let them gloat or*ld exalt themselves over me when my feet slip.”
For*pn I am about to fall, and*ld my pain is ever with me.
I*ln confess my iniquity; I*ld am troubled by my sin.
Many*ln have become my enemies without cause; those*ld who hate me without reason are numerous.
Those*ln who repay my good with evil lodge*ld accusations against me, though*ld I seek only to do what is good.
Lord,*spn do not forsake me; do*ld not be far from me, my God.
Come*ln quickly to help me, my*ld Lord and my Savior.
